abstracts.cdata!:
The Earthquake Reconstruction Project,
            as a result of an earlier earthquake, seeks to (i)
            rehabilitate and reconstruct the San Salvador metropolitan
            area; and (ii) support the expansion of the capital city
            towards the north (Apopa) which is less vulnerable to
            earthquakes.  The project also hopes to (iii) rehabilitate
            the microenterprise sector; and (iv) strengthen the
            Government's capacity to plan and manage the
            reconstruction efforts and enhance its preparedness to deal
            with national emergencies.  To this end, the project
            involves several components which are aimed at helping San
            Salvador to recover from this natural disaster.  They
            include:  (a) housing lines of credit; (b) schools and
            public buildings; (c) roads and public services; and (d)
            micro-enterprise credits.  The project further includes (e)
            training; as well as (f) studies and technical assistance.
